title: Assur Archive 26
description: Southwest of the Adad ziqqurrat in Assur, in dE5V, researchers found 6 clay tablets, some of which had envelopes, in the remains of a destroyed private house. The archive, belonging to Dadaya, dates to the reigns of Aššur-etel-ilāni (ca. 630–627 BC) and Sin-šarru-iškun (ca. 626-612 BC) and mostly contains loan documents.

properties.description: Representative locations of the Neo-Assyrian archive at Assur on the basis of Pedersén 1987 Plan(s) 62.
properties.title: Plan location of Assur Archive 26
